body.scope: External competitive intelligence validation of Grok Sandcrawler results: government AI offerings + FINOS AIGF; check for 5-feature benchmark full match.
benchmark_5_features: Epistemic controls (authority detection, confidence tracking / provenance)
Production validation (>=6 months continuous real use)

findings.system: GSA MAS adds Claude, Gemini, ChatGPT
findings.notes: Confirms availability/procurement channel; does not itself prove 6+ months continuous use.
ASL-3 described as deployment + security standards targeting CBRN misuse.

findings.system: DoD awards up to $200M contracts to Anthropic/Google/OpenAI/xAI (July 14, 2025)
findings.notes: Contract awards are strong deployment intent signals; still not direct proof of >=6 months continuous real use.
Initiative exists; public docs are high-level on enforcement details.
Framework/spec with ongoing meetings and v2 release; governance blueprint more than turnkey runtime control plane.

meta_conclusion.reason: Publicly verifiable offerings emphasize runtime governance and procurement; self-modifying/delta-mining governance is not evidenced in these deployments, and the >=6mo production criterion is not clearly met for most 2025 launches.
recommended_internal_delta: Add ExternalEvidenceSweep intake type with strict VERIFIED/ASSUMED tagging and a ProductionProof checklist (2-of-4 rule).
Promote Governance Enforcement v0 as P0 roadmap item: passive controls -> active lint/denylist before output.

evidence_log_v2_row.failure_signal: Production>=6mo + self-modification not verifiable from public evidence for major gov suites.
